snippet: Christine C. Quinn’s recent disclosure that she had suffered from bulimia in her 20s was part of an effort to deepen her image with voters, but the effect is unclear.
abstract: Ginia Bellafante Big City column argues that New York City mayoral contender Christine C Quinn's admission, made in her memoir, of having struggled with bulimia in her 20s is intended to curry favor with voters by portraying her as relatable, but questions whether revelation will have intended effect; says Quinn, who has in some ways grown distant from her liberal roots, has political rather than personal image problems.
lead_paragraph: Christine C. Quinn’s recent disclosure that she had suffered from bulimia in her 20s was part of an effort to deepen her image with voters, but the effect is unclear.

headline.main: A Cloudy Revelation From a Mayoral Candidate
